property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: A Pakistani child waiting for aid after an earthquake

note.text: In Pakistan, civilians stare at others out of curiosity more than they do in the U.S. If you notice someone staring at you, do not react. However, you should never stare at someone of the opposite gender. Doing so is considered inappropriate.

During conversations, Pakistanis tend to make less eye contact than Americans do. In addition, it is considered offensive to maintain eye contact with or wink at someone of the opposite gender. Donâ€™t be offended if a Pakistani counterpart, especially one of the opposite gender, avoids eye contact while speaking with you.
